sen.j: 舞鶴港（まいづるこう）は京都府舞鶴市にある重要港湾。
sen.e: Maizuru Port, located in Maizuru City Kyoto Prefecture, is a key port.
Maizuru Port, located in Maizuru City Kyoto Prefecture, is a key port.
Maizuru Port, located in Maizuru City, Kyoto Prefecture, is a key port.
sen.cmt: カンマを追加しました。

sen.j: 港湾管理者は京都府。
sen.e: Kyoto Prefecture manages the port.
The port is maganged by Kyoto Prefecture
The port is managed by Kyoto Prefecture.
sen.cmt: スペルを修正しました。

sen.j: 2004年より京都舞鶴港の通称が与えられている。
sen.e: The nickname of Kyoto Maizuru Port was given in 2004.
The nickname of Kyoto Maizuru Port was given in 2004.
The nickname of Kyoto Maizuru Port was given in 2004.

sen.j: 明治時代に日本海側唯一の海軍鎮守府舞鶴鎮守府が開府し、軍港として繁栄した。
sen.e: During Meiji Period, Maizuru Chinju-fu--only one navy base on the Japan Sea side of Japan--opened and flourished as a naval port.
During Meiji Period, Maizuru Chinju-fu--the only navy base on the Japan Sea side of Japan--opened and flourished as a naval port.
During the Meiji period, Maizuru Chinju-fu--the only navy base on the Japan Sea side of Japan--opened and flourished as a naval port.
sen.cmt: period小文字にしました。"Meiji period"→"the Meiji period"に変更しました。

sen.j: 日露戦争の際、そのほとんどの船がここから出港したことは有名で、シベリア抑留等からの引き揚げの際も多数の船が舞鶴港に帰港している。
sen.e: It is well known that most ships set sail from this port during the Russo-Japanese War, and many repatriation ships from Siberia returned home at this port.
It is well known that most ships set sail from this port during the Russo-Japanese War, and many repatriation ships from Siberia returned home at this port.
It is well known that most ships set sail from this port during the Russo-Japanese War, and many repatriation ships from Siberia returned home at this port.

sen.j: 現在は大きく2つの港に分れており、東港が海上自衛隊舞鶴地方総監部が鎮座する軍港、西港が中華人民共和国・大韓民国・ロシアなどへの定期航路をもつ国際貿易港として発展している。
sen.e: It is largely divided into two ports--East Port and West Port; East Port is a navy port where the Maritime Self-Defense Force Maizuru District Headquarters is located; West Port has been developed as an international trade port having regular services heading for and from countries such as People's Republic of China, Republic of Korea, and Russian Federation.

It is largely divided into two ports--East Port and West Port; East Port is a navy port where the Maritime Self-Defense Force Maizuru District Headquarters is located; West Port has been developed as an international trade port having regular services heading to and from countries such as the People's Republic of China, Republic of Korea, and Russian Federation.

It is largely divided into two ports--East Port and West Port; East Port is a navy port where the Maritime Self-Defense Force Maizuru District Headquarters is located; West Port has been developed as an international trade port having regular services heading to and from countries such as the People's Republic of China, Republic of Korea, and Russian Federation.

sen.j: なお第3種漁港である舞鶴漁港についても本項で述べる。
sen.e: This article describes Maizuru Fishing Port of Category 3.
This article describes the Maizuru Fishing Port, which falls under Category 3 for fishing ports.
This section describes the Maizuru Fishing Port, which falls under Category Three for fishing ports.
sen.cmt: 数字をスペルアウトしました。"article"→"section"に変更しました。

tit.cmt: 他の記事と統一しました。

sen.j: 日本海に面する舞鶴港は、若狭湾西部の舞鶴湾にあり、外海に対して入り江になっているため、比較的天候に左右されにくく、天然の良港として知られている。
sen.e: Maizuru Port, which faces the Japan Sea and located in the Maizuru bay, the western part of the Wakasa Bay, is known as a good port, because it forms an inlet off the open sea and is less subject to weather conditions.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Maizuru Port, which faces the Japan Sea and is located in the western part of the Wakasa Bay within Maizuru Bay, is known as a suitable port, due to its formation as an inlet off the open sea and is less subject to weather conditions.

Maizuru Port, which faces the Japan Sea and is located in the western part of the Wakasa Bay within Maizuru Bay, is known as a suitable port, due to its formation as an inlet off the open sea and is less subject to weather conditions.

sen.j: 港湾自体は大きく分けて東港と西港に分けられる。
sen.e: The harbor itself is largely divided into East Port and West Port.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: The harbor itself is largely divided into East Port and West Port.
The harbor itself is largely divided into East Port and West Port.

sen.j: なお、2005年（平成17年）に、共同通信社と全国地方新聞社連合会が企画・編集した「港50選」のひとつに選ばれている。
sen.e: For reference, it was selected as one of the "Best 50 Port," planned and compiled by Kyodo News in 2005.
For reference, it was selected as one of the "Best 50 Ports," planned and compiled by Kyodo News in 2005.
For reference, it was selected as one of the 'Best Fifty Ports,' planned and compiled by Kyodo News and Federation of Local Newspaper Companies in 2005.
sen.cmt: 数字をスペルアウトしました。全国地方新聞社連合会 を追加しました。

tit.e: Maizuru Higashi Port, Maizuru East Port
Maizuru Higashi Port, Maizuru East Port

sen.j: 東港は1901年に軍港に指定され舞鶴鎮守府が開設されて以来、大日本帝国海軍が港湾のみならず、本来単なる入り江に過ぎなかった東舞鶴地区の土地造成も行った。
sen.e: Since the East Port was designated as naval port to house the Maizuru Chinju-fu in 1901, the former Japanese Imperial Navy not only developed it as the harbor but also reclaimed the land of Higashi Maizuru area--once merely an inlet.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Since the East Port was designated as a naval port to house the Maizuru Chinju-fu in 1901, the former Japanese Imperial Navy not only developed it as the harbor but also reclaimed the land of Higashi Maizuru area--once merely an inlet.

Since the East Port was designated as a naval port to house the Maizuru Chinju-fu in 1901, the former Japanese Imperial Navy not only developed it as the harbor but also reclaimed the land of Higashi Maizuru area--once merely an inlet.

sen.j: 現在でも海上自衛隊の第3護衛隊群や舞鶴総監部などが基地を構え日本海側防衛の重要拠点となっている。
sen.e: Now it still provides bases for the Escort Flotilla 3 and Maizuru District Headquarters of the Maritime Self-Defense Force, playing a role of a key strongpoint to defend the Japan Sea side of Japan.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Today, it still provides bases for the Escort Flotilla 3 and Maizuru District Headquarters of the Maritime Self-Defense Force, acting as a key strongpoint to defend the Japan Sea side of Japan.
Today, it still provides bases for the Escort Flotilla 3 and Maizuru District Headquarters of the Maritime Self-Defense Force, acting as a key strongpoint to defend the Japan Sea side of Japan.

sen.j: 近年では朝鮮民主主義人民共和国の工作船事件などで軍事上の重要度が高まり、舞鶴飛行場が建設され舞鶴航空隊や特別警備隊が配備された。
sen.e: In recent years, its military importance is increasing because incidences of North Korean covert-operation boats occurred, and thus the Maizuru Air Port has been built to deploy the Maizuru Fleet Air Force and the Special Boarding Unit

In recent years, its military importance is increasing due to incidences involving North Korean covert-operation boats. The Maizuru Air Port was built to deploy the Maizuru Fleet Air Force and the Special Boarding Unit

In recent years, its military importance is increasing due to incidences involving North Korean covert-operation boats; therefore the Maizuru Air Port was built to deploy the Maizuru Fleet Air Force and the Special Boarding Unit
sen.cmt: 一つの文章にしました。

sen.j: また東港では旧帝国海軍舞鶴工廠の伝統を受け継ぐユニバーサル造船があり、自衛隊桟橋の先に造船ドックを見ることができる。
sen.e: Universal Shipbuilding Corporation, which has observed the traditions of the Old Imperial Navy Maizuru Navy Arsenal, is also located in the East Port, and its shipbuilding dock can be seen at the end of the Maritime Self-Defense Force's dock.

Universal Shipbuilding Corporation, which has observed the traditions of the Old Imperial Navy Maizuru Navy Arsenal, is also located in the East Port, and its shipbuilding dock can be seen at the end of the Maritime Self-Defense Force's dock.

Universal Shipbuilding Corporation, which has observed the traditions of the Old Imperial Navy Maizuru Navy Arsenal, is also located in the East Port, and its shipbuilding dock can be seen at the end of the Maritime Self-Defense Force's dock.

sen.j: 舞鶴フェリーターミナル
sen.e: Maizuru Ferry Terminal
Maizuru Ferry Terminal
Maizuru Ferry Terminal

sen.j: 東舞鶴駅より2.3km先にある前島埠頭に設置されている。
sen.e: The terminal is at Maejima Wharf, 20 km ahead of Higashi-Maizuru Station.
The terminal is at Maejima Wharf, 20 km ahead of Higashi-Maizuru Station.
The terminal is at Maejima Wharf, 2.3 km ahead of Higashi-Maizuru Station.

sen.j: 公共交通機関でのアクセスは通常はないが、夏季等繁雑期のみフェリー発着時間に合わせて東舞鶴駅より路線バスの運行が行われることがある。
sen.e: Usually it is not accessible by public transport but a local bus service may be available in response to the arrival and departure times on occasions when many visitors can be expected, for example in summer.

Usually it is not accessible by public transport but a local bus service may be available in response to the arrival and departure times on occasions when many visitors can be expected, for example in summer.

Usually it is not accessible by public transportation but a local bus service may be available from Higashi-Maizuru Station in response to the arrival and departure times on occasions when many visitors can be expected, for example in summer.
sen.cmt: 東舞鶴駅より を追加しました。

sen.j: また新大阪駅からの連絡バスが繁雑期以外にも運行されていることが多いため比較的使いやすい。
sen.e: The liaison bus from Shin-Osaka Station is in comparison convenient because the service can be more often available even not in busy occasions.
The liaison bus from Shin-Osaka Station is convenient because the service is more often available even during times outside of rushhour.
The liaison bus from Shin-Osaka Station is convenient because the service is more often available even during times outside of busy seasons.
sen.cmt: 繁雑期を busy season としまｓｈした。

sen.j: タクシーで東舞鶴駅まで約5分ほどかかる。
sen.e: It takes 5 minutes by Taxi from the Higashi-Maizuru Station.
It takes 5 minutes by Taxi from the Higashi-Maizuru Station.
It takes about five minutes by Taxi from the Higashi-Maizuru Station.
sen.cmt: 数字をスペルアウトしました。

sen.j: 車の場合舞鶴東インターチェンジより約15分程度。
sen.e: It is about 15 minutes' drive from the Maizuru-higashi Interchange.
It is about 15 minutes' drive from the Maizuru-higashi Interchange.
It is about fifteen-minute drive from the Maizuru-higashi Interchange.
sen.cmt: 数字をスペルアウトしました。

sen.j: 以前は西港の舞鶴港湾合同庁舎付近がフェリー埠頭であり、東港の前島埠頭付近に海保が常駐していた。
sen.e: When the wharf of the ferry was once near the Maizuru port joint government building, maritime safety officials were regularly stationed near the Maejima Wharf of the West Port.
When the wharf of the ferry was once near the Maizuru port joint government building, maritime safety officials were regularly stationed near the Maejima Wharf of the West Port.

The wharf of the ferry was once located near the Maizuru port joint government building of the West Port, and maritime safety officials were regularly stationed near the Maejima Wharf of the East Port.

sen.j: 観光名所・遺跡
sen.e: Sightseeing Spot and Historic Sites
sen.cmt: 遺跡ではなく史跡と訳しました
sen.e: Sightseeing Spots and Historic Sites
Sightseeing spots and historic sites
sen.cmt: 小タイトル用に変更しました。

sen.j: 東港は前述の通り、明治時代より軍港として発展してきた関係から、多くの旧日本海軍関連の遺跡を有している。
sen.e: The East port, which has been developed as a naval port since the Meiji Period, has a lot of historic sites related to the former.Imperial Japanese Navy.
The East port, which has been developed as a naval port since the Meiji Period, has many historic sites related to the former Imperial Japanese Navy.
The East port, which has been developed as a naval port since the Meiji period, has many historic sites related to the former Imperial Japanese Navy.

sen.j: 特に近年では舞鶴赤レンガ倉庫群などでは映画の撮影なども行われるなどしている。
sen.e: In particular, Maizuru Red-brick Warehouses has been recently used in shooting films.
In particular, Maizuru Red-brick Warehouses has been recently used in shooting films.
In particular, Maizuru Red-brick Warehouses has been recently used in shooting films.

sen.j: 他にも世界中の煉瓦を集めた赤れんが博物館や、舞鶴市の歴史や風俗を展示した舞鶴市政記念館なども整備されており、観光名所ともなっている。
sen.e: Other sightseeing spots include the Aka Renga Museum having a collection of bricks from all over the world and the Maizuru Municipal Administrative Museum exhibiting the history and customs of Maizuru City.

Other sightseeing spots include the Aka Renga Museum having a collection of bricks from all over the world and the Maizuru Municipal Administrative Museum exhibiting the history and customs of Maizuru City.

Other sightseeing spots include the Aka Renga Museum having a collection of bricks from all over the world and the Maizuru Municipal Administrative Museum exhibiting the history and customs of Maizuru City.

sen.j: また2008年（平成20年）には国の重要文化財に指定される見込み。
sen.e: The East Port is going to be designated as important cultural property in 2008.
The East Port will be designated as important cultural property in 2008.
The East Port will be designated as important cultural property in 2008.

sen.j: 春には引揚記念公園、共楽公園、円山公園、夕潮台公園などの桜が市民にも親しまれている。
sen.e: People in the city enjoy cherry blossoms at Repatriation Memorial Museum, Kyoraku Park, Maruyama Park, and Yushiodai Park every spring.
People in the city enjoy cherry blossoms at Repatriation Memorial Museum, Kyoraku Park, Maruyama Park, and Yushiodai Park every spring.
People in the city enjoy cherry blossoms at Repatriation Memorial Museum, Kyoraku Park, Maruyama Park, and Yushiodai Park every spring.

tit.e: Maizuru Nishi Port, Maizuru West Port
Maizuru Nishi Port, Maizuru West Port
tit.cmt: カッコ内に入れました。

sen.j: 西港は田辺城 (丹後国)の城下町として発展してきたため、江戸時代より商港として発展してきた。
sen.e: The West Port, located in and developed as a castle town of the Tanabe-jo Castle (Tango Province), has been developed as a commercial port since the Edo Period.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: The West Port, located in and developed as a castle town of the Tanabe-jo Castle (Tango Province), has been developed as a commercial port since the Edo Period.
The West Port, located in and developed as a castle town of the Tanabe-jo Castle (Tango Province), and has been developed as a commercial port since the Edo period.

sen.j: しかし、1989年に舞鶴若狭自動車道・舞鶴西インターチェンジが開通したことにより、物流の要として注目されている。
sen.e: However, it is attracting attention as a key logistic center, because the Maizuru-nishi Interchange of the Maizuru Wakasa Express Way opened in 1989.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: However, it is attracting attention as a key logistic center, due to the opening of the Maizuru-nishi Interchange of the Maizuru Wakasa Express Way in 1989.
However, it is attracting attention as a key logistic center, due to the opening of the Maizuru-nishi Interchange of the Maizuru Wakasa Expressway in 1989.
sen.cmt: スペースを削除しました。

sen.j: 現在、平成20年初頭の完成を目指して、国際多目的ターミナル・和田埠頭（仮称）が建設中で、埠頭完成時には5万トン級のフルコンテナ船が就航できる。
sen.e: Wada Wharf, a multi-purpose terminal (tentative name) is under construction with an aim to be completed early 2008; the wharf, when completed, enables a full-scale container ships weighing 50 ton class to berth.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Wada Wharf, a multi-purpose terminal (tentative name) is under construction with aims to be completed early 2008; the wharf, when completed, will enable full-scale container ships in the 50 ton class to berth.

Wada Wharf, a multi-purpose international terminal (tentative name) is under construction with aims to be completed early 2008; the wharf, when completed, will enable full-scale container ships in the 50,000 ton class to berth.
sen.cmt: 数字を修正しました。International を追加しました。

sen.j: また埠頭から高速道路へ直接アクセスできる国道27号バイパス「西舞鶴道路」も計画中であり、国際物流港としての重要性がますます高まりつつある。
sen.e: In addition the National Highway route No. 27 Nishi-maizuru Road is also planned, and thereby the port is enhancing its importance as the international logistic port.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: In addition the National Highway route No. 27 Nishi-maizuru Road is also being planned, and thereby the port is enhancing its importance as an international logistic port.
In addition, 'Nishi-maizuru Road,' which is a bypass of the National Route 27 is also being planned, and thereby the port is enhancing its importance as an international logistic port.

sen.j: また港内には舞鶴港湾合同庁舎内に海上保安庁第八管区海上保安本部もある。
sen.e: The Japan Coast Guard 8th Regional Coast Guard Headquarters is in the Maizuru harbor joint government office located in this port.
The Japan Coast Guard 8th Regional Coast Guard Headquarters is in the Maizuru harbor joint government office located in this port.
The Japan Coast Guard Eighth Regional Coast Guard Headquarters is in the Maizuru harbor joint government office located in this port.
sen.cmt: 数字をスペルアウトしました。

sen.j: また西港地区は漁港漁場整備法における舞鶴漁港を内包し（法的にはこの区域は舞鶴港ではない）、大型定置網漁船の拠点となっている。
sen.e: The West Port, which physically includes the Maizuru Fishing Port governed under the Act on Development of Fishing Ports and Grounds (The fishing port area does not legally belong the Maizuru Port.), provides bases for large scale vessels equipped with a stationary net.

sen.j: 舞鶴市により、海産物即売所である舞鶴港とれとれセンターが建てられている。
sen.e: Maizuru city has built the Maizuru Port Toretore Center, a whole sale shop for marine products
Maizuru city also built the Maizuru Port Toretore Center, a wholesale shop for marine products

sen.j: 2004年（平成16年）9月30日には、生活道路たる国道の扱いで存続し70年の歴史を持つ舞鶴汽船が、利用者の減少と船の老朽化により廃止された。
sen.e: On September 30, the Maizuru steam ship, which was dealt as a national road with role of a community road, closed its 70-year history due to a decline in passengers and deterioration of the ship.
On September 30, the Maizuru steam ship, which was dealt as a national road with roles as a community road, closed its 70-year history due to a decline in passengers and deterioration of ships.

tit.j: 朝鮮民主主義人民共和国との関係
tit.e: Relationship with Democratic People's Republic of Korea
Relationship with Democratic People's Republic of Korea
Relationship with Democratic People's Republic of Korea

sen.j: 舞鶴港は、朝鮮民主主義人民共和国からの入港隻数が252隻と国内最多である。
sen.e: The total number of vessels entered the Maizuru Port from Democratic People's Republic of Korea was 262, the largest in Japan.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: The total number of vessels entering the Maizuru Port from the Democratic People's Republic of Korea was 262, the largest in Japan.
The total number of vessels entering the Maizuru Port from the Democratic People's Republic of Korea was 252, the largest in Japan.

sen.j: 国内2社が接岸・荷役業務を行っていたが、うち1社は拉致の高まりを受けて取引を停止した。
sen.e: Two Japanese companies were engaged in landing and loading businesses with such vessels but one of the companies stopped deals because a mounting criticism for abduction issues.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Two Japanese companies were engaged in landing and loading businesses with such vessels but one of the companies stopped deals because of mounting criticism stemming from abduction issues.
Two Japanese companies were engaged in landing and loading businesses with such vessels but one of the companies stopped deals because of mounting criticism stemming from abduction issues.

sen.j: 残る日本通運舞鶴海運支店も北朝鮮によるミサイル発射後、北朝鮮との取引を停止していたが、2006年7月28日より舞鶴港に北朝鮮からの貨物船が荷降ろしを始めている。
sen.e: The rest, International Transport Department, Maizuru Marine Transport Office, Nippon Express Co., Ltd. stopped dealings with North Korean vessels after launches of missiles by North Korea, but North Korean freights started to be seen unloading goods on July 28, 2006.

The rest, International Transport Department, Maizuru Marine Transport Office, Nippon Express Co., Ltd. stopped dealings with North Korean vessels after missile launches by North Korea. However, North Korean freights started to be seen unloading goods on July 28, 2006.

The rest, International Transport Department, Maizuru Marine Transport Office, Nippon Express Co., Ltd. stopped dealings with North Korean vessels after missile launches by North Korea; however, North Korean freights started to be seen unloading goods in Maizuru Port on July 28, 2006.

sen.j: 2006年10月の北朝鮮による核実験の実施に伴い、国内への北朝鮮籍の入港は禁止されることとなる見通しである。
sen.e: With nuclear tests by North Korea in October 2006, North Korean vessels will be banned from entering Japanese ports.
With nuclear tests by North Korea in October 2006, North Korean vessels will be banned from entering Japanese ports.
With nuclear tests by North Korea in October 2006, North Korean vessels will be banned from entering Japanese ports.

sen.j: 1901年（明治34年）：舞鶴鎮守府開庁。
sen.e: In 1901, Maizuru Chinju-fu opened.
In 1901, Maizuru Chinju-fu opened.
1901: Maizuru Chinju-fu opened.

sen.j: 1922年（大正11年）：内務省、舞鶴西港を指定港湾に指定。
sen.e: In 1922, the Ministry of Interior designated Maizuru West Port as a designated port.
In 1922, the Ministry of Interior designated Maizuru West Port as a designated port.
1922: The Ministry of Interior designated Maizuru West Port as a designated port.

sen.j: 1945年（昭和20年）：舞鶴地方引上援護局が設置される。
sen.e: In 1945, the Maizuru Repatriation Relief Bureau was established.
In 1945, the Maizuru Repatriation Relief Bureau was established.
1945: The Maizuru Repatriation Relief Bureau was established.

sen.j: 1951年（昭和26年）：重要港湾に指定される。
sen.e: In 1951, It was designated as key harbor.
In 1951, It was designated as key harbor.
1951: It was designated as key harbor.

sen.j: 1952年（昭和27年）：舞鶴東港に海上警備隊（海上自衛隊）を設置。
sen.e: In 1952, the Coastal Safety Force was established in the Maizuru East Port.
In 1952, the Coastal Safety Force was established in the Maizuru East Port.
1952: The Coastal Safety Force was established in the Maizuru East Port.

sen.j: 1958年（昭和33年）：ナホトカ定期航路開設。
sen.e: In 1958, regular service to Nakhodka started.
In 1958, regular service to Nakhodka started.
1958: Regular service to Nakhodka started.

sen.j: 1970年（昭和45年）：舞鶴～小樽間に新日本海フェリーが就航。
sen.e: In 1970, Shin Nihonkai Ferry started ferry service between Maizuru and Otaru.
In 1970, Shin Nihonkai Ferry started ferry service between Maizuru and Otaru.
1970: Shin Nihonkai Ferry started ferry service between Maizuru and Otaru.

sen.j: 1985年（昭和60年）：舞鶴港線廃止。
sen.e: In 1985, Maizuru steam ship was abolished.
In 1985, Maizuru steam ship was abolished.
1985: Maizuru steam ship was abolished.

sen.j: 1986年（昭和61年）：日中・日本海定期航路開設。
sen.e: In 1986, Japan-China Japan Sea regular service started.
In 1986, Japan-China Japan Sea regular service started.
1986: Japan-China Japan Sea regular service started.

sen.j: 1990年（平成02年）：韓国・プサン定期航路開設。
sen.e: In 1990, regular service to Korea Busan started.
In 1990, regular service to Korea Busan started.
1990: Regular service to Busan, Korea started.
sen.cmt: Busan, Korea としました。"In 1990, regular"→"1990: Regular"に変更しました。

sen.j: 1995年（平成07年）：FAZ(輸入促進地域)の指定を受ける。
sen.e: In 1995, the port was designated as FAZ(foreign access zone)
In 1995, the port was designated as FAZ(foreign access zone)
1995: The port was designated as FAZ (foreign access zone).
sen.cmt: スペース、ピリオドを追加しました。"In 1995, the"→"1995: The"に変更しました。

sen.j: 1997年（平成09年）：FAZ施設として舞鶴21が開業。
sen.e: In 1997, Maizuru 21 opened as a facility for FAZ.
In 1997, Maizuru 21 opened as a facility for FAZ.
1997: Maizuru 21 opened as a facility for FAZ.

sen.j: 1999年（平成11年）：大連・青島定期コンテナ航路開設。
sen.e: In 1999, regular container service to Dalian, Qingdao started to
In 1999, regular container service to Dalian, Qingdao was started.
1999: Regular container service to Dalian, Qingdao was started.

sen.j: 2005年（平成17年）：航路再編が行われ、舞鶴～上海間が直通に。
sen.e: In 2005, with the restructuring of the service route, the direct service between Maizuru and Shanghai started.
In 2005, the direct service between Maizuru and Shanghai started with the restructuring of the service route.
2005: The direct service between Maizuru and Shanghai started with the restructuring of the service route.

sen.j: 2007年（平成19年）：神原汽船の日中定期コンテナ航路が開設。
sen.e: In 2007, Kambara Kisen Company started Japan-China regular container service.
In 2007, Kambara Kisen Company started Japan-China regular container service.
2007: Kanbara Kisen Company started Japan-China regular container service.
sen.cmt: "In 2007,"→"2007:"に変更しました。"Kambara"→ "Kanbara "に変更しました。
